name: Somesh Jha
content: Somesh Jha Somesh Jha Lubar Professor Computer Sciences Department University of Wisconsin Madison, WI 53706 (608)-262-9519 jha "at" cs.wisc.edu Twitter: @jhasomesh Background I graduated with a Ph.D. from the School of Computer Science at the Carnegie Mellon University. Currently I am the Lubar professor in the Computer Sciences Department at the University of Wisconsin, Madison. My resume can be found here [PDF] Research My main areas of interests are at the intersection of security and formal methods (FM). Currently my active interests are in adversarial machine learning (AML) and privacy. I have a peripheral interest in several topics (e.g. computational finance), but I have not been actively involved in the area for a several years. Note: I have not been updating by publications page for a few years. My DBLP page is here and my Google scholar page is here. If you need to get a copy of one of my papers or have questions about them, feel free to contact me. Current Projects Center for Trustworthy Machine Learning Current Students Zhicheng Cai (Ph.D) Jiefeng Chen (Ph.D.) Uyeong Jang (Ph.D.). Amrita Roy Chowdhury (Ph.D.). Jinman Zhao (Ph.D. student) List of alumni of my group can be found here Teaching I have taught several courses in the past. Currently I teach CS-435 (INTRODUCTION TO CRYPTOGRAPHY) and CS-763 (SECURITY AND PRIVACY FOR DATA SCIENCE) Consulting and Entrepreneurship I have done several engagements as an expert witness (see my resume). I have also been involved with startups (see below). Novashield (a company in malware detection) Tala Security (focussing on web security): 2016--Present
